source.84c8bda0:
ds = df['Q1'].value_counts().reset_index()
ds.columns = ['age', 'count']
ds = ds.sort_values(['count'],ascending =False)
plt.figure(figsize=(15,8))
ax1 = sns.barplot(x="age", y="count", data=ds)
source.1d609114: Masters degree holders are the highest R programing language user followed by bachelors, this can be skewed because of the high sample size of bachelors and masters survey takers.
source.04346009: SQL being is extensively used querying language to fetch data from the database is an essential part in data field which is being reflected in its utility in different age group and degree holders.
source.0456f83e: Python is the most widely used programing language in the data and ML field. This can possibly be attributed to the fact that since most of the degree holders may have made a career trasition from software development where python is extensively used, also to the fact the specialized degree holders may not be bacheorate, masters or doctorate in statistics and related field where R is intensively used.
